did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Collection contains a looseleaf binder that includes publicity for the program, correspondence, course descriptions, grant proposals and evaluations, newsletters, awards, newspaper clippings, printed material and other records documenting the evolution and impact of Project Calc.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Mathematics Dept. Project Calc records, 1988-1996, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid derived from MARC record, November 2014

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Project Calc was a lab-based approach to teaching calculus. It was funded by the National Science Foundation from 1989-1993 and received several awards. Professors Lawrence Moore and David A. Smith of the Math Department were the developers.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains a looseleaf binder that includes publicity for the program, correspondence, course descriptions, grant proposals and evaluations, newsletters, awards, newspaper clippings, printed material and other records documenting the evolution and impact of Project Calc.

note.label: General note
note.p: Unprocessed collection. Cataloged from accession records.
